definition: rational number (i.e. fraction of two integers, math.)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
field of rational numbers (math.), usually denoted by Q

sentences.english: In decimal form, rational numbers are either terminating or repeating decimals.
sentences.chinese: 在十进位中，有理数的位数有限，或者可以重复。

sentences.english: It can deal with rational numbers and complex numbers. It has matrix support as well.
sentences.chinese: 它可以处理有理数和复数，也支持矩阵。

sentences.english: We call the set of real integers and fractions "rational numbers."
sentences.chinese: 我们把整数和分数的集合称为“有理数”。“

sentences.english: This module gives support for rational number arithmetic.
sentences.chinese: 此模块提供对有理数算法的支持。

definition: a nonnegative number (i.e. positive or zero)
to square a number/to calculate the square
a nonpositive number (i.e. negative or zero)
